channel.title: News on Eclipse IoT
channel.description: Recent content in News on Eclipse IoT

item.title: Open IoT Challenge – Final submissions
item.description: The Open IoT challenge ended earlier this week, and it was pretty exciting to see the final submissions coming in the form of blog posts and video during the last hours before the deadline…

item.title: The Open IoT Challenge projects are way cool
item.description: There are only a few days left for the participants to the Open IoT Challenge to wrap up their projects and share the final results of what they have achieved over the course of the last couple months…

item.title: Case Study MQTT: Why Open Source and Open Standards Drives Adoption
item.description: For the last 3 years, we have been talking about why IoT needs open source and open standards to be successful. We are now seeing great examples of why this is so true and why open communities will lead IoT adoption…

item.title: Announcing the Open IoT Challenge
item.description: 2014 is almost over, and one of the first big events for Eclipse IoT next year will be EclipseCon 2015, March 9-12 in Burlingame, California. If you haven’t seen the EclipseCon program already, I highly…
